Data.name: EstimatedRestorationUTC
Data.value: We are experiencing a major outage event and are unable to provide ETRs at this time. ETRs will be updated as they become available.

Data.name: DistrictBroadcastMessages
Data.value:
[{"BroadcastMessageId":92,"Created":"2025-02-25T15:01:05.2448179+00:00","MessageText":"We have made great progress overnight after strong winds hit our region. Thanks to a quick response, PUD crews have restored power to tens of thousands of customers over the past 10 hours. Most of the damage they’re seeing is damaged crossarms and wires caused by falling trees and limbs.
We have about 30 crews currently working on repairs, including a crew working on removing a tree in the line along Bothell-Everett Highway. Crews are also working on significant repairs in Edmonds, at Murphy’s Corner and Thrasher’s Corner, and at the intersection of 164th Street and SR 527 and Hwy. 99 and Airport Road.
Winds are expected to remain gusty and could potentially increase in force this morning. We will continue to work on repairs throughout the day as long as it remains safe and expect to have all customers restored by later tonight.
We will update this message at 1 p.m.
"}]

[{"BroadcastMessageId":92,"Created":"2025-02-25T15:01:05.2448179+00:00","MessageText":"We have made great progress overnight after strong winds hit our region. Thanks to a quick response, PUD crews have restored power to tens of thousands of customers over the past 10 hours. Most of the damage they’re seeing is damaged crossarms and wires caused by falling trees and limbs.
We have about 30 crews currently working on repairs, including a crew working on removing a tree in the line along Bothell-Everett Highway. Crews are also working on significant repairs in Edmonds, at Murphy’s Corner and Thrasher’s Corner, and at the intersection of 164th Street and SR 527 and Hwy. 99 and Airport Road.
Winds are expected to remain gusty and could potentially increase in force this morning. We will continue to work on repairs throughout the day as long as it remains safe and expect to have all customers restored by later tonight.
We will update this message at 1 p.m.
"}]

Data.name: EstimatedRestorationUTC
Data.value: We are experiencing a major outage event and are unable to provide ETRs at this time. ETRs will be updated as they become available.

[{"BroadcastMessageId":92,"Created":"2025-02-25T15:01:05.2448179+00:00","MessageText":"We have made great progress overnight after strong winds hit our region. Thanks to a quick response, PUD crews have restored power to tens of thousands of customers over the past 10 hours. Most of the damage they’re seeing is damaged crossarms and wires caused by falling trees and limbs.
We have about 30 crews currently working on repairs, including a crew working on removing a tree in the line along Bothell-Everett Highway. Crews are also working on significant repairs in Edmonds, at Murphy’s Corner and Thrasher’s Corner, and at the intersection of 164th Street and SR 527 and Hwy. 99 and Airport Road.
Winds are expected to remain gusty and could potentially increase in force this morning. We will continue to work on repairs throughout the day as long as it remains safe and expect to have all customers restored by later tonight.
We will update this message at 1 p.m.
"}]

Data.name: EstimatedRestorationUTC
Data.value: We are experiencing a major outage event and are unable to provide ETRs at this time. ETRs will be updated as they become available.

We have about 30 crews currently working on repairs, including a crew working on removing a tree in the line along Bothell-Everett Highway. Crews are also working on significant repairs in Edmonds, at Murphy’s Corner and Thrasher’s Corner, and at the intersection of 164th Street and SR 527 and Hwy. 99 and Airport Road.
Winds are expected to remain gusty and could potentially increase in force this morning. We will continue to work on repairs throughout the day as long as it remains safe and expect to have all customers restored by later tonight.
We will update this message at 1 p.m.
"}]

[{"BroadcastMessageId":92,"Created":"2025-02-25T15:01:05.2448179+00:00","MessageText":"We have made great progress overnight after strong winds hit our region. Thanks to a quick response, PUD crews have restored power to tens of thousands of customers over the past 10 hours. Most of the damage they’re seeing is damaged crossarms and wires caused by falling trees and limbs.
We have about 30 crews currently working on repairs, including a crew working on removing a tree in the line along Bothell-Everett Highway. Crews are also working on significant repairs in Edmonds, at Murphy’s Corner and Thrasher’s Corner, and at the intersection of 164th Street and SR 527 and Hwy. 99 and Airport Road.
Winds are expected to remain gusty and could potentially increase in force this morning. We will continue to work on repairs throughout the day as long as it remains safe and expect to have all customers restored by later tonight.
We will update this message at 1 p.m.
"}]

Data.name: EstimatedRestorationUTC
Data.value: We are experiencing a major outage event and are unable to provide ETRs at this time. ETRs will be updated as they become available.

Crews are also working on significant repairs in Edmonds, at Murphy’s Corner and Thrasher’s Corner, and at the intersection of 164th Street and SR 527 and Hwy. 99 and Airport Road.
Winds are expected to remain gusty and could potentially increase in force this morning. We will continue to work on repairs throughout the day as long as it remains safe and expect to have all customers restored by later tonight.
We will update this message at 1 p.m.
"}]
